title: Seems some typos in the figure
body:
In the section "Bind Multiple Outputs", the figure seems have three typos.
The code "G = mx.sym.Group([E,D])" should be "G = mx.sym.Group([E,C])", 
"d_out" should be "c_out", 
and
"executor.output[1] = 10 //D" in the lower right corner should be "executor.output[1] = 10 //C".

title: simplify travis
body:
1. reduced the number of builds, which will shorten the build time since the number of parallel jobs is often by 4

```
  # code analysis
  - TASK=lint
  # test doc build
  - TASK=doc
  # build mxnet.so with CUDA
  - TASK=build
  # run tests/cpp
  - TASK=cpp_test
  # run tests/python with python2/3
  - TASK=python_test
```
1. use cache to store the data
2. mv scripts/\* to test/travis, removed the empty bin and lib directory 
3. fixed make doc problem

title: __neg__ should return new array instead of changing self
body: Not sure it was a bug or intentional design. I believe the `__neg__` function should not change contents of `self`. Instead, it should return a new array. It is really weird if after executing, say, `x += -grad`, the contents of `grad` is negated.

title: Windows Compatibility
body:
Hi everyone,

I have created a Visual Studio 2013 solution to build MXNet in winodws. I have tried my best to make the solution as similar as the ones in dmlc-core & cxxnet's `windows` directory.

Some minor compatible problems are also fixed by adding some macros. However, some of them may also works in linux. You may have better choices to merge them.

The 3rdparty libraries are uploaded to [BaiduYun](http://pan.baidu.com/s/1x7fw6). Since I am in the mainland of China, it is difficult for me to access DropBox or OneDrive. May someone help me upload the `mxnet_3rdparty.zip` to one of the foreign online dsik and modify the link?

A build instruction is provided in `./windows/README.md`. To be honest, it is not easy to configure. May it helps the ones who can only work in windows.

title: OSX Travis Script
body:
- The script is updated to support osx builds.
- The OSX option is not enabled because the python package have platform dependent issues that need to be resolved, likely to be string encoding or ctypes issue.
